Create Interpretation Arguments for Gaussian Mixture Models

Source: R/gm_model_data.R
interpretation_args_gm.Rd

Creates a configuration object for GM-specific interpretation parameters.

Usage

interpretation_args_gm(
  analysis_type = "gm",
  n_clusters = NULL,
  covariance_type = NULL,
  min_cluster_size = NULL,
  separation_threshold = NULL,
  profile_variables = NULL,
  weight_by_uncertainty = NULL,
  plot_type = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

analysis_type

Character string, must be "gm"

n_clusters

Integer or NULL. Number of clusters (default: NULL, inferred from model)

covariance_type

Character or NULL. Covariance structure (e.g., "VVV", "EII") (default: NULL, inferred from model)

min_cluster_size

Integer or NULL. Minimum meaningful cluster size (default from registry: 5)

separation_threshold

Numeric or NULL. Overlap threshold for diagnostics (default from registry: 0.3)

profile_variables

Character vector or NULL. Subset of variables to focus on (default: NULL)

weight_by_uncertainty

Logical or NULL. Whether to weight by uncertainty if available (default from registry: FALSE)

plot_type

Character or NULL. Visualization type: "heatmap", "parallel", "radar", or "auto" (default from registry: "auto")

...

Additional arguments (currently unused)

Value

A list of class "interpretation_args_gm" with validated parameters

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Create GM-specific configuration
gm_args <- interpretation_args(
  analysis_type = "gm",
  min_cluster_size = 10,
  separation_threshold = 0.2,
  plot_type = "heatmap"
)

# Use in interpretation
interpret(
  fit_results = mclust_model,
  variable_info = var_info,
  interpretation_args = gm_args,
  llm_provider = "ollama",
  llm_model = "llama3"
)
} # }
